document.docAuthor: Webb, Donald W. & Metz, Mark A.
document.masterDocTitle: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A Revision of the New World Genera Brachylinga Irwin and Lyneborg and Lysilinga Irwin and Lyneborg (Diptera: Therevidae: Therevinae) with the Description of a New Genus, Elcaribe Webb

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology Concavus (Latin) = hollowed or arched inward. This name is used as an adjective and
refers to the deeply emarginate posterior margin of the hypoproct.

Brachylinga concava
is taxonomically associated with
B. bicolor
and
B. divaricata
in lacking setae on the katepisternum; in having the postocular, mesonotal, and coxal macrosetae dark reddish brown; in having the male parafacial black ventrally, silver dorsally; and in having the halter knob yellow.
Brachylinga concava
differs from
B. bicolor
and
B. divaricata
in having the apical margin of the hypoproct ( Fig. 10 ) deeply emarginate and the gonocoxite in lateral view ( Fig. 171 ) with the basal half oval, the apical half attenuate. Females of
B. bicolor , B. concava
,
B. divaricata
, and
B. ornata
are indistinguishable based on external characters. Internally
B. bicolor
,
B. concava
and
B. ornata
have the spermathecal ducts directed anteriorly ( Figs. 188, 192, 199 ) while in
B. divaricata
the spermathecal ducts are directed laterally before bending at a right angle and continuing anteriorly ( Fig. 194 ).

Head . Length 0.76 mm . Ommatidia smaller ventrally and laterally. Frons pruinescence white ventrally, black dorsally with white pruinescence separating black area medially; setae black. Antenna/head length 0.76; scape black, pruinescence gray, pedicel and flagellum dark brown, base of first flagellomere dark yellow; scape length 0.16 mm , width 0.11 mm , length/width 1.5, scape/pedicel length 2.0, scape/flagellum width 0.69, setae pale yellow, sparse; pedicel length 0.08 mm , length/width 0.7; flagellum length 0.36 mm , width 0.16 mm , length/width 2.3, flagellum/scape length 2.3. Parafacial pruinescence black, dorsal third silver. Maxillary palpus dark reddish brown; length 0.40 mm , length/ width 5.0; setae pale reddish brown. Genal setae white. Occipital setae white becoming pale yellow, appressed, lanceolate dorsally. Postocular macrosetae dark reddish brown.

Thorax. Macrosetae dark reddish brown, 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 2 dc, 2 sc. Mesonotum brownish gray; setae black, short intermixed with pale yellow, lanceolate, appressed setae. Pleuron pruinescence gray; setae white on propleuron, anepisternum, laterotergite, metanepisternum, and scutellum, absent on katepisternum. Wing. Membrane pale gray; veins pale brown; length 4.8 mm , width 1.5 mm , length/width 3.2; pterostigma pale yellow, narrow; cell m 3 closed, petiolate. Halter pale yellow. Legs. Coxa setae white, present on posterior surface of midcoxa; macrosetae dark reddish brown. Femora dark reddish brown; ventral setae white on fore­ and midfemora intermixed with dark brown setae on forefemur; av 0:0:4, pv 0:0:7. Tibiae dark yellow, apex reddish brown. Tarsomeres 1–2 dark yellow, apex dark reddish brown; 3–5 dark reddish brown.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3–4 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 2 dc, 2 sc. Legs. Anteroventral macrosetae 0:0:3–4; pv 0:0:3–7.
Similar to male except as follows.

Head . Antenna dark brown, occasionally with base of flagellum dark yellow. Frons dark brownish gray, ventral third silver with dark brown area dorsolaterally (shape of area varies from distinct circle to broad band which extend across frons when specimen is rotated); setae dark brown, short on brownish gray area of frons. Parafacial reddish brown (occasionally glossy), pruinescence silver dorsally. Maxillary palpus dark yellow, apical fourth dark reddish brown; setae dark yellow to pale reddish brown.
Thorax. Macrosetae 3 np, 2 sa, 1 pa, 2 dc, 2 sc. Legs. Anteroventral macrosetae 0:0:2–6, pv 0:0:2–7.

Abdomen. Dark reddish brown, pruinescence white; tergites 2–7 with posterior margin narrow dark yellow or yellowish orange, tergite 2–6 with posterolateral area of white priunescence; dorsal setae dark reddish brown on dark reddish brown areas and white appressed across posterior margin of tergites 1–3; lateral setae dark reddish brown.
Terminalia
(MEI 138880). Furca ( Fig. 192 ) oval; length 0.40 mm , width 0.22 mm ; anterolateral projection short. Common duct ( Fig. 192 ) shorter than furca. Spermathecal duct ( Fig. 192 ) diverging anteriorly, broad basally with bulbous expansion.

Distribution Brachylinga concava
is known from Costa Rica and Panama ( Fig. 214 ).

Brachylinga concava
has been primarily collected in Malaise traps from October to April.

Type specimen. The holotype male of
Brachylinga concava Webb
(MEI 007482) is labeled "COSTA RICA, Guanacaste Province , 10 km W San Miguel, 22 February 1991 , DWWebb/MEIrwin, Malaise trap" and is deposited in the INHS.
